text: English grammar level - a program to
master the difficult rules in English
grammar
brought to you by let's talk Institute
for English language and finishing
skills let's learn what is an auxiliary
verb auxiliary verbs have no meaning on
their own they are necessary for the
grammatical structure of a sentence
but they do not tell us very much alone
we usually use auxiliary verbs with main
verbs they help the main verb which has
the real meaning words like M his bar
was worth has path and heart are called
auxiliary verbs these auxiliary verbs
are used with ordinary verbs to make
tenses passive forms questions and
negatives for example he is writing boys
are playing
I am walking note the auxiliary verb M
will come only with I the words like is
was am and has are called singular
auxiliary verbs the words like are were
and have are called plural auxiliary
verbs is am are have has our present
tenses was were had our past tenses note
a verb must agree with its subject in
number and person look at these examples
the aeroplane is flying high the birds
are flying high note in the first
example the subject aeroplane is
singular so the auxiliary verb used is
also singular in the second example
birds is the subject and it's plural so
a plural auxiliary verb is used now
let's look at some examples it is now 3
o clock how many days are there in a
week my friend's mother is a dentist
Mary was the winner in the race you are
a carpenter you were driving when I
called here in these examples it is
important to note that are and were are
plural auxiliary verbs these auxiliary
verbs will always come with you that is
the second person singular some more
examples our college has a big tennis
court
many youngsters have Facebook addiction
John has two cars and one motorcycle now
you will have a doubt that although cars
is plural
why has is used as an auxiliary verb
note John is the subject in the sentence
and it's singular so we have used has as
a singular auxiliary verb some more
examples Mary is singing while John and
Sarah are dancing Maria and Natasha were
arguing some time back note auxiliary
verbs are also called helping verbs this
was a demonstration video for English
grammar level 2 for complete program
visit us at let's talk company dot in if
you liked this video kindly put your
comments right below this video for more
videos you can subscribe to our youtube
channel by clicking the subscribe button
just above this video thank you for
watching us take care
